exampleContent.title: Gap Fill Examples
exampleContent.description: Learn how to complete sentences by choosing the right words from a word bank
learningPoints: Read the entire sentence to understand the context
Consider the meaning and grammar of each option
Look for clues in the surrounding words
Think about what type of word fits (noun, verb, adjective)
Choose words that make the sentence logical and complete

sections.title: Context Clues Strategy
sections.description: Learn to use surrounding words and sentence structure to choose the right word

examples.sentence: The cat sat on the warm _____ in the sunshine.
examples.explanation: The word 'warm' and 'sunshine' suggest something that can be heated by the sun. A rock makes the most sense in this context.

examples.sentence: She _____ her homework carefully before turning it in.
examples.explanation: In the context of homework and 'carefully', 'checked' is the only logical verb choice.

examples.sentence: The _____ flowers bloomed beautifully in spring.
examples.explanation: Flowers are typically described by their appearance. 'Colorful' is the only adjective that makes sense for flowers.

sections.title: Grammar Patterns
sections.description: Understanding how different types of words fit into sentence structures

examples.sentence: The dog _____ across the yard quickly.
examples.explanation: This sentence needs a verb (action word) to describe what the dog did. 'Ran' is the only verb in the options.

examples.sentence: The _____ house stood on the hill.
examples.explanation: The sentence needs an adjective to describe the house. 'Tall' is the only adjective that describes size or appearance.

exercises.sentence: The cat climbed up the tall _____.
exercises.explanation: Cats climb up trees. The other words don't make sense in this context.

exercises.sentence: She _____ her teeth before going to bed.
exercises.explanation: 'Brushed' is the correct verb for what you do with teeth as part of bedtime routine.

exercises.sentence: The _____ butterfly landed on the flower.
exercises.explanation: 'Beautiful' is an adjective that appropriately describes a butterfly. The other words are either adverbs or verbs that don't fit.

exercises.sentence: He _____ the ball to his friend across the playground.
exercises.explanation: 'Threw' is the past tense verb that describes the action of sending a ball to someone.

exercises.sentence: The _____ rain made everyone run for shelter.
exercises.explanation: 'Heavy' is an adjective that describes intense rain that would make people seek shelter.
